item.title: 1.3 Examples
item.description:
Limits on Graphs

Ex 1: Limit of a Piecewise Function

a. Determine

\[ \lim_{{x \to -1}} f(x) \]

b. Determine

\[ \lim_{{x \to 2}} f(x) \]

Solution a

You can form the conclusion that the limit exists by the following logic:

  1. The left hand limit is -1: \( \lim_{{x \to -1^-}} f(x) = -1 \)
  2. The right hand limit is -1: \( \lim_{{x \to -1^+}} f(x) = -1 \)
  3. Since the left hand and the right hand limits are equal we conclude the the limit of the function both exists and its value is -1: \[ \lim_{{x \to -1}} f(x) = -1 \]
